column2: ibs pain , 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have had a hard time finding Librax, had to use several generics, each time they changed companies, the generic becomes less and less effective.  This is the only drug that has helped me, why is it so hard to find?

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
Morningstar, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I understand I will never be symptom free but this has been a great help managing my IBS.  Most days are good, the key is understanding my symptoms and knowing when to take two a day. Most days I'm good with one.  Biggest benefit is cutting down on spasms.

calgal, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I've tried several medications for IBS and none have worked as well as Librax. The only problem is the expence and it does make me drowsy,but it is worth it.I wonder why medicare does not cover this medication?

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have been suffering with IBS since I was 7 and I am now 25 it has not been an easy road. I have been on different medicines thru-out the years and sometimes they help and sometimes they dont. Librax has helped me more times then it hasn't. Overall it is pretty good. I take this and Bentyl.

column2: 75 or over Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: This was wonderful for me.  Then my company stopped handling it because it is no longer Medicare D approved.  It is known as a Desi drug...(non-effect).  It may be for some, but I have been suffering since I can't get it.

column2: pattiann1947, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have taken Librax for 2 weeks.  I am told by the Doctor that this is not a long term medication I can take, so now I will have to go back on Bentyl.  I feel that the Librax controls my IBS better than the Bentyl.  I want to know if Librax can only be used for short term periods, or is it just when you have a flare up with the IBS again?

column2: rachel, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have Terrible spastic colon. This has been the only medicine that helps when the spasm is in force.

column2: suggi, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Does not work.  Only the chlorazipoxide-clidinium (also Librax) works for me and worked for years and does not have all those side effects of this drug.  Will not take this drug again - only the chlorazipoxide-clidinium.

column2: alicia, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
fairmiss, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Having IBS:primary symptom:diahrea, librax stops/slows/eases the cramping - usually within 20 minutes. Side effect:dry mouth. Long term use: memory problems. However, if you are in pain, I would still rec. it. Tried Levbid & had double vision!

column2: payshunt, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This drug was used in a clinical trial that I was involved in about 20 years ago. The drug didn't do anything to change my IBS-constipation predominance, but it made me not care because I had relatively no pain. I chose not to remain on the drug, as it only worked as a pain reliever for me.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
45-54 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: Librax has help me for 27 years.Now the pharmacy said the FDA has took off the market.Now we the people will suffer with out it.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I was diagnosed with IBS in 1994. I started taking Librax a couple months after that. I do not take it daily because I don't want my body to get immune to it. I have taken it just as needed since 1994, and it has always worked very well for me. I wouldn't want to take anything else.

column9: this is the most useful and effective medication i've used to date.
